___beerjson.description: Root element of all beerjson documents.

___fermentations.description: A collection of steps providing process information for common fermentation procedures.

$eref.description: FermentationProcedureType defines the procedure for performing fermentation.

___mashes.description: A collection of steps providing process information for common mashing procedures.

$eref.description: This defines the procedure for performing unique mashing processes.

___grain_temperature.description: Initial grain temperature prior to the start of the mash.

___miscellaneous_ingredients.description: Records for adjuncts which do not contribute to the gravity of the beer.

___use_for.description: Used to describe the purpose of the miscellaneous ingredient, e.g. whirlfloc is used for clarity.

$eref.description: MiscellaneousType collects the attributes of an ingredient to store as record information.

___fermentables.description: Records for any ingredient that contributes to the gravity of the beer.

___kolbach_index.description: The Kolbach Index, also known as soluble to total ratio of nitrogen or protein, is used to indcate the degree of malt modification. A value above 35% is desired for simple single infusion mashing, undermodified malt may require multiple step mashes or decoction.

___diastatic_power.description: Diastatic power is a measurement of malted grains enzymatic content. A value of 35 Lintner is needed to self convert, while a value of 100 or more is desirable.

___max_in_batch.description: The recommended maximum percentage to use in a grain bill.

___alpha_amylase.description: Where diastatic power gives the total amount of all enzymes, alpha amylase, also known as dextrinizing units, refers to only the total amount of alpa amylase in the malted grain. A value of 25-50 is desirable for base malt.

___recommend_mash.description: True if the fermentable must be mashed, false if it can be steeped.

___protein.description: The percentage of protein. Higher values may indicate a possibility of haze, or lautering issues.

$eref.description: FermentableType collects the attributes of a fermentable ingredient to store as record information.

___profiles.description: Records for water profiles used in brewing.

$eref.description: WaterBase provides unique properties to identify individual records of  brewing water.

___packaging.description: A collection of steps providing process information for common packaging procedures.

$eref.description: Describes the procedure for packaging your beverage.

___cultures.description: Records detailing the wide array of unique cultures.

___best_for.description: Recommended styles for a particular culture.

___alcohol_tolerance.description: The recommended limit of abv by the culture producer before attenuation stops.

___max_reuse.description: Maximum number of times to reuse a culture before a new lab source is recommended.

___flocculation.description: Floculation refers to the ability of yeast to aggregate to form large flocs which drop out of suspension.

___glucoamylase.description: A glucoamylase positive culture is capable of producing glucoamylase, the enzyme produced through expression of the diastatic gene, which allows yeast to attenuate dextrins and starches leading to a very low FG. This is positive in some saison/brett yeasts as well as the new gulo hybrid by Omega yeast labs.

___temperature_range.description: The recommended temperature range of fermentation by the culture producer.

___pof.description: A POF+ culture is capable of producing phenols, which is a common distinctive property of saison, and brett yeasts.

$eref.description: CultureInformation collects the attributes of a microbial culture.

___hop_varieties.description: Records detailing the many properties of unique hop varieties.

___percent_lost.description: Defined as the percentage of hop alpha lost in 6 months of storage.

$eref.description: VarietyInformation collects the attributes of a hop variety to store as record information.

___version.description: Explicitly encode beerjson version within list of records.

___equipments.description: Provides necessary information for brewing equipment.

$eref.description: Provides necessary information for brewing equipment set.

___boil.description: A collection of steps providing process information for common boil procedures.

$eref.description: BoilProcedureType defines the procedure for performing a boil. A boil procedure with no steps is the same as a standard single step boil.

___styles.description: Records detailing the characteristics of the beer styles for which judging guidelines have been established.

$eref.description: StyleType provide information for Style categorization

___recipes.description: Records containing a minimal collection of the description of ingredients, procedures and other required parameters necessary to recreate a batch of beer.

$eref.description: RecipeType composes the information stored in a beerjson recipe.

___ibu_estimate.description: Used to differentiate which IBU formula is being used in a recipe. If formula is modified in any way, eg to support whirlpool/flameout additions etc etc, please use `Other` for transparency.

___carbonation.description: The final carbonation of the beer when packaged or served.

___final_gravity.description: The gravity of beer at the end of fermentation.

___packaging.description: Describes the procedure for packaging your beverage.

___mash.description: This defines the procedure for performing unique mashing processes.

___color_estimate.description: The color of the finished beer, using SRM or EBC.

___taste.description: Used to store subjective tasting notes, and rating.

___fermentation.description: FermentationProcedureType defines the procedure for performing fermentation.

___ingredients.description: A collection of all ingredients used for the recipe.

___original_gravity.description: The gravity of wort when transffered to the fermenter.

___boil.description: Defines the procedure for performing a boil. A boil procedure with no steps is the same as a standard single step boil.

___apparent_attenuation.description: The total apparent attenuation of the finished beer after fermentation.

___efficiency.description: Used to store each efficiency component, including conversion, and brewhouse.

___beer_pH.description: The final beer pH at the end of fermentation.

$eref.description: The timing object fully describes the timing of an addition with options for basis on time, gravity, or pH at any process step.

___pH.description: Used to indicate when an addition is added based on a desired specific gravity. eg Add brett when pH is 3.4.

___time.description: What time during a process step is added, eg a value of 2 days for a dry hop addition would be added 2 days into the fermentation step.

___specific_gravity.description: Used to indicate when an addition is added based on a desired specific gravity. E.G. Add dry hop at when SG is 1.018.

___step.description: Used to indicate what step this ingredient timing addition is referencing. EG A value of 2 for add_to_fermentation would mean to add during the second fermentation step.

___duration.description: How long an ingredient addition remains, this was referred to as time in the BeerXML standard. E.G. A 40 minute hop boil additions means to boil for 40 minutes, and a 2 day duration for a dry hop means to remove it after 2 days.

___continuous.description: A continuous addition is spread out evenly and added during the entire process step, eg 60 minute IPA by dogfish head takes all ofthe hop additions and adds them throughout the entire boil.

___timing_object.description: The timing object fully describes the timing of an addition with options for basis on time, gravity, or pH at any process step.
